subject: Climate & Environment
title: The Value of Biodiversity
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Value of Biodiversity.

hook.text: Nature provides services worth an estimated $125 trillion per year â€” for free.

buildup.text: Pollination, water filtration, carbon storage, and flood protection all come from ecosystems.

discovery.text: Half of modern medicines trace back to natural compounds found in plants and animals.

twist.text: We have screened less than 1% of known species for useful chemicals. The rest is unexplored.

climax.text: When we lose a species, we may lose the cure for a disease we haven't faced yet.

punchline.text: Every extinct species is a library burned before we read it.

quiz.question: How much are nature's services estimated to be worth annually?
